member.name: T:TournamentSystem.MyFormatConverter
member.summary: Converter that is used for serializing a tournament into my specific JSON format
member.remarks: To use it, pass it into the converters of JsonSerializerOptions when using JsonSerializer.Deserialize/Serialize()

member.name: T:TournamentSystem.MyFormatConverter.SetLinksReport
member.summary: Class used as intermediate step when reconstructing a set from JSON
member.remarks: This is necessary, as my JSON format uses IDs to replace nested references - reads IDs and all info into the SetLinksReport which can then be used later to create the sets.

member.name: T:TournamentSystem.MyFormatConverter.GameLinksReport
member.summary: Class used as intermediate step when reconstructing a game from JSON
member.remarks: This is necessary, as my JSON format uses IDs to replace nested references - reads IDs and all info into the GameLinksReport which can then be used later to create the game.

member.name: M:TournamentSystem.MyFormatConverter.Read(System.Text.Json.Utf8JsonReader@,System.Type,System.Text.Json.JsonSerializerOptions)
member.summary: JSONConverter method that is then called when you use JsonSerializer.Deserialize{Tournament}(jsonBody).
member.remarks: Injects all necessary custom converters - tries to preserve as much of the outside JsonSerializerOptions as possible
member.returns: Tournament? - Tournament on success, null on failure

member.name: M:TournamentSystem.MyFormatConverter.Write(System.Text.Json.Utf8JsonWriter,TournamentSystem.Tournament,System.Text.Json.JsonSerializerOptions)
member.summary: JsonConverter method that is called when you use JsonSerializer.Serialize{Tournament}(Tournament tournament).

member.name: T:TournamentSystem.SetLinksConverter
member.summary: JSONConverter for reading JSON into SetLinksReport
member.remarks: There is no write method, as you should never be serializing SetLinksReports - convert to a proper Set first, then serialize.

member.name: M:TournamentSystem.SetLinksConverter.Read(System.Text.Json.Utf8JsonReader@,System.Type,System.Text.Json.JsonSerializerOptions)
member.summary: JsonConverter method used when deserializing JSON into SetLinksReport
member.remarks: Uses property number counting - if adding or removing a property in the future, don't forget to update the figure or figure out a more elegant solution. At this current stage, this means that to deserialize JSON into a SetLinksReport, all properties must be appear.
member.returns: SetLinksReport? - SetLinkReport on success, null on failure

member.name: M:TournamentSystem.SetLinksConverter.Write(System.Text.Json.Utf8JsonWriter,TournamentSystem.MyFormatConverter.SetLinksReport,System.Text.Json.JsonSerializerOptions)
member.summary: Not implemented - you should be serializing Set objects, not SetLinksReport objects.

member.name: T:TournamentSystem.SetConverter
member.summary: JSONConverter for writing Sets to JSON
member.remarks: There is no read method, as you should never be deserializing into a Set directly - use SetLinksReport for that, as my format uses Id references instead of nesting.

member.name: M:TournamentSystem.SetConverter.Read(System.Text.Json.Utf8JsonReader@,System.Type,System.Text.Json.JsonSerializerOptions)
member.summary: Not implemented - you should be deserializing into SetLinksReport.

member.name: M:TournamentSystem.SetConverter.Write(System.Text.Json.Utf8JsonWriter,TournamentSystem.Set,System.Text.Json.JsonSerializerOptions)
member.summary: JsonConverter method used when serializing sets into JSON.
member.remarks:
Uses Ids to replace nested references for entrants and other sets.
Currently, uses serialization of IWinnerDeciders by casting them into IWinnerDecider, and calling SetWinnerDeciderConverter methods. In the future, can either be replaced by a reflection search for an appropriate method to use instead given a custom class that implements IWinnerDecider, or expanding SetWinnerDeciderConverter code in this assembly.

member.name: T:TournamentSystem.SetWinnerDeciderConverter
member.summary: JsonConverter for serializing/deserializing IWinnerDecider objects

member.name: M:TournamentSystem.SetWinnerDeciderConverter.Read(System.Text.Json.Utf8JsonReader@,System.Type,System.Text.Json.JsonSerializerOptions)
member.summary: Method for reading JSON into IWinnerDecider
member.remarks: Given that we need the type property before we decide what properties to expect, we read the entire object first, only then parsing it appropriately. This differs from how other Read methods work. When reading "type" property, will do a reflection search in the executing assembly to try to find the correct type to instantiate. Can be changed if we want to implement custom IWinnerDeciders outside of this assembly.
member.returns: IWinnerDecider? - IWinnerDecider on success, false on failure

member.name: M:TournamentSystem.SetWinnerDeciderConverter.Write(System.Text.Json.Utf8JsonWriter,TournamentSystem.Set.IWinnerDecider,System.Text.Json.JsonSerializerOptions)
member.summary: Method for serializing IWinnerDeciders into JSON
member.remarks: Currently only supports BestOfDecider, with other IWinnerDeciders throwing an exception. This can be changed so that instead it simply serializes all the properties using reflection. I opted not to do this for now, given we have all the control over IWinnerDeciders 'inhouse', but if custom IWinnerDeciders pop up outside what we know, we can rethink this (along with letting custom IWinnerDeciders have their own converters).

member.name: T:TournamentSystem.GameLinksConverter
member.summary: JsonConverter for deserializing JSON into GameLinksReport

member.name: M:TournamentSystem.GameLinksConverter.Read(System.Text.Json.Utf8JsonReader@,System.Type,System.Text.Json.JsonSerializerOptions)
member.summary: Method for deserializing JSON into GameLinksReport
member.remarks: Use this when reading serialized games, this handles Id-based referencing that is used in my JSON format.
member.returns: GameLinksReport? - GameLinksReport on success, null on failure

member.name: M:TournamentSystem.GameLinksConverter.Write(System.Text.Json.Utf8JsonWriter,TournamentSystem.MyFormatConverter.GameLinksReport,System.Text.Json.JsonSerializerOptions)
member.summary: Not implemented - you should be serializing Game objects, not GameLinksReport objects.

member.name: T:TournamentSystem.GameConverter
member.summary: JsonConverter for serializing Game objects to JSON

member.name: M:TournamentSystem.GameConverter.Read(System.Text.Json.Utf8JsonReader@,System.Type,System.Text.Json.JsonSerializerOptions)
member.summary: Not implemented - you should be deserializing into GameLinksReport

member.name: M:TournamentSystem.GameConverter.Write(System.Text.Json.Utf8JsonWriter,TournamentSystem.Set.Game,System.Text.Json.JsonSerializerOptions)
member.summary: JsonConverter method for serializing Game into JSON
member.remarks: Replaces nested references with Ids as per my JSON format.

member.name: T:TournamentSystem.EntrantConverter
member.summary: JsonConverter for Entrant objects

member.name: M:TournamentSystem.EntrantConverter.Read(System.Text.Json.Utf8JsonReader@,System.Type,System.Text.Json.JsonSerializerOptions)
member.summary: JsonConverter method for deserializing JSON into Entrant
member.remarks: Has to read the entire object first so it can retrieve the "type" property, then select the appropriate properties it needs to find based on whether it is an IndividualEntrant or TeamEntrant.
member.returns: Entrant? - Entrant on success, null on failure

member.name: M:TournamentSystem.EntrantConverter.ReadIndividualEntrant(System.Text.Json.JsonElement)
member.summary: Method used for parsing a given JsonElement (here being used to pass the representation of a Json object) into IndividualEntrant
member.remarks: The checks for whether or not the JsonElement truly represents an IndividualEntrant are done elsewhere.

member.name: M:TournamentSystem.EntrantConverter.Write(System.Text.Json.Utf8JsonWriter,TournamentSystem.Entrant,System.Text.Json.JsonSerializerOptions)
member.summary: JsonConverter method for serializing an Entrant object into JSON
member.remarks: Different handling done here for IndividualEntrant vs TeamEntrant

member.name: M:TournamentSystem.JsonParseHelper.ParseJsonElementIntoDict(System.Text.Json.JsonElement)
member.summary: Helper method I used for working with JsonElements that parse it into a dictionary of properties and string values.

member.name: T:TournamentSystem.Tournament
member.summary: Class that stores all the data about the tournament.
member.remarks: Nearly all async methods for Tournament handle their own locking.

member.name: T:TournamentSystem.Tournament.TournamentLockHandler
member.summary: Class that is used as a wrapper for locking the seperate parts of the tournament
member.remarks: This was originally used for logging purposes, as we can add logging of acquiring locks + report the async nature of it for debugging. This no longer is in the code, but let it be know this was for better logging purposes.

members.member:
Each of these methods returns the IDisposable, that when disposed releases the lock. Don't forget to release the lock when not being used.
IMPORTANT: For the sake of preventing deadlocks, the following consistent order is used throughout - when expanding ensure you lock in this order: _setLocker _entrantsLocker _dataLocker _statusLocker
Failure to do so may lead to deadlock

member.name: M:TournamentSystem.Tournament.#ctor
member.summary: Default parameterless constructor for Tournament.
member.remarks: If you need to create a tournament from existing data - either use looping over the class's methods, or parse in a JSON.

member.name: M:TournamentSystem.Tournament.TryMoveToInProgressAsync
member.summary: Method used for finalizing the setup of a tournament. Part of this method is verifying the structure of the tournament is valid (see VerifyStructureAsync for details)
member.returns: Bool - Returns true on success, otherwise false

member.name: M:TournamentSystem.Tournament.TryMoveToFinishedAsync
member.summary: Method used for moving tournament from InProgress to Finished.
member.remarks: There are no complex checks here - this can be expanded in the future, such as checking all sets have a winner/loser.
member.returns: Bool - Returns true on success, otherwise false

member.name: M:TournamentSystem.Tournament.SetStatus(TournamentSystem.Tournament.TournamentStatus)
member.summary: Method used only for JSON conversion - hard override of the tournament status
member.remarks: Only to be used in synchronous contexts, this is a hard override and should be used sparingly

member.name: M:TournamentSystem.Tournament.VerifyStructureAsync
member.summary: Method that checks if tournament is of a valid structure. Checks that there are no cycles in the bracket and that each set has the correct amount of set/incoming players.
member.returns: Bool - Returns true if structure is valid, otherwise false

member.name: M:TournamentSystem.Tournament.VerifyAmountOfEntrants
member.summary: Method to check that each set has the correct amount of incoming and set entrants (each set should have exactly 2 entrants, with those being able to either be coming from other sets or already be set.
member.returns: Bool - Returns true on success, otherwise false

member.name: M:TournamentSystem.Tournament.VerifyNoCycles
member.summary: Method to check that no cycles exist in the bracket.
member.remarks: Uses DFS to check for cycles. On a large bracket, this method can be slower than other methods.
member.returns: Bool - Returns true on success, otherwise false

member.name: M:TournamentSystem.Tournament.AddSetAsync(TournamentSystem.Set)
member.summary: Method for adding a Set to the tournament.
member.returns: Bool - Returns true on success, otherwise false

member.name: M:TournamentSystem.Tournament.TryRemoveSetAsync(System.Int32)
member.summary: Method for removing sets for the tournament (by id).
member.returns: Bool - Returns true on success, otherwise false

member.name: M:TournamentSystem.Tournament.TryGetSetAsync(System.Int32)
member.summary: Method for retrieving a set from the collection of sets.
member.returns: Set? - on success the Set, on fail null

member.name: M:TournamentSystem.Tournament.AddEntrantAsync(TournamentSystem.Entrant)
member.summary: Method for adding an Entrant to the tournament.
member.returns: Bool - Returns true on success, otherwise false

member.name: M:TournamentSystem.Tournament.TryRemoveEntrantAsync(System.Int32)
member.summary: Method for removing entrants for the tournament (by id).
member.returns: Bool - Returns true on success, otherwise false

member.name: M:TournamentSystem.Tournament.TryGetEntrantAsync(System.Int32)
member.summary: Method for retrieving an entrant from the collection of entrants.
member.returns: Entrant? - on success the Entrant, on fail null

member.name: M:TournamentSystem.Tournament.AddOrEditDataAsync(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Method for adding or editing a specific key value pair of Data. If the key does not yet exist, it is added, otherwise the existing value is just overwritten.
member.returns: Bool - Returns true on success, otherwise false

member.name: M:TournamentSystem.Tournament.DeleteDataAsync(System.String)
member.summary: Method for deleting from data. Deletes the key-value pair in the Data dictionary associated with the key.
member.returns: Bool - Returns true on success, otherwise false

member.name: M:TournamentSystem.Tournament.TryGetDataAsync(System.String)
member.summary: Method for retrieving a given value from the Data dict by key.
member.returns: string? - on success the string, on fail null

member.name: M:TournamentSystem.Tournament.GetAllDataAsync
member.summary: Method for getting the entire Data dict for further processing.
member.remarks: The actual returned value is a copy of the Data dict, not a reference to the actual Dict. This is for thread-safety, as we cannot guarantee that the Dict won't change after returning and we don't changes to the Dict to be reflected back into the tournament.
member.returns: Dictionary{string, string} - the Data dictionary

member.name: M:TournamentSystem.Tournament.GetStatusAsync
member.summary: Method for getting the status of the tournament.
member.remarks: Explicit setting of the status is not allowed (except for JSON deserialization) - use the TryMoveTo... method
member.returns: TournamentStatus - the status of the tournament

member.name: T:TournamentSystem.Set
member.summary: Class the represents individual sets in the tournament (each set can be comprised of multiple games).
member.remarks: Be careful of which methods expect certain locks to already be locked - not all the lock handling occurs in this class. The properties are all synchronous (as is expected), so use these with caution in async contexts. I have not written async get and set methods, but these might be necessary for fine control.

member.name: T:TournamentSystem.Set.SetLockHandler
member.summary: See Tournament.TournamentLockHandler for explanation why these exist.
member.remarks: Note that for sets, I have opted to lock the entire set as a whole, and not individual fields - in most use cases, only one user will be sending requests to read/edit any given set, so it would be too much overhead to have such fine control. This can be changed if it is found that the aforementioned is actually a common usecase.

member.name: M:TournamentSystem.Set.#ctor(System.Int32)
member.summary: Constructor for Set given an ID.
member.remarks: I only have a constructor with only ID, as the fields will be set later. This is because of the order in which a tournament must be reconstructed from JSON, but also because these fields will change inherently as a tournament progresses. An entrant on the other hand should not change once it is created, as it is immutable.

member.name: T:TournamentSystem.Set.IWinnerDecider
member.summary: IWinnerDecider is an interface used for specifying custom set-winner conditions.
member.remarks: E.g. tennis will have a WinnerDecider that works with the win-by-two condition, while most sports just have a first to X wins condition.

member.name: T:TournamentSystem.Set.BestOfDecider
member.summary: BestOfDecider models the behaviour of a best of X format, where X is specified when created.

member.name: M:TournamentSystem.Set.BestOfDecider.DecideWinner(TournamentSystem.Entrant,TournamentSystem.Entrant,System.Collections.Generic.List{TournamentSystem.Set.Game})
member.summary: Method that applies the BestOf rules for to decide a winner (if any), along with handling certain illegal states of the set.
member.returns: Entrant? - if a winner is found winning Entrant is returned, otherwise null

member.name: M:TournamentSystem.Set.FillSetFromReport(System.Collections.Generic.Dictionary{System.Int32,TournamentSystem.Set},System.Collections.Generic.IReadOnlyDictionary{System.Int32,TournamentSystem.Entrant},TournamentSystem.MyFormatConverter.SetLinksReport)
member.summary: Method used only for JSON conversion - required due to JSON using ID based storage of entrants and sets along with Status and the like being inaccesible from outside the Set class

member.name: M:TournamentSystem.Set.UpdateSetBasedOnGames
member.summary:
If a set is InProgress, this method will evaluate whether the games are enough to decide a winner using the provided IWinnerDecider. If a winner is found, Status is set to Finished.
This method assumes that the set it is working with is appropriately locked already.
member.remarks: This method expects that the set is already locked for writing before the method is called.
member.returns: Bool - true if the set was updated, false on failure or no update

member.name: M:TournamentSystem.Set.TryMoveToWaitingForStart
member.summary: Method that tries to move Set to WaitingForStart, if all entrants and the winnerDecider are set (and we are in a valid state)
member.remarks: This method assumes that the set it is working with is appropriately locked for writing already.
member.returns: Bool - true on success, false on failure

member.name: M:TournamentSystem.Set.TryMoveToInProgress
member.summary: Method that tries to move Set to InProgress, if all conditions are met (we are in a valid state)
member.remarks: This method assumes that the set it is working with is appropriately locked for writing already.
member.returns: Bool - true on success, false on failure

member.name: M:TournamentSystem.Set.TryProgressingWinnerAndLoser
member.summary: Method for moving winner and loser to the sets they play in next (if any
member.remarks: This method assumes that the set it is working with is appropriately locked already for writing.
member.returns: Bool - true on success, failure on failure or no update

member.name: T:TournamentSystem.Set.Game
member.summary: Class representing a single game inside a set

member.name: M:TournamentSystem.Set.Game.#ctor(TournamentSystem.Set,System.Int32,TournamentSystem.Entrant,TournamentSystem.Entrant,System.Collections.Generic.Dictionary{System.String,System.String})
member.summary: Normal constructor for Game - we let Status and Winner be decided by the constructor

member.name: M:TournamentSystem.Set.Game.#ctor(TournamentSystem.Set,System.Int32,TournamentSystem.Entrant,TournamentSystem.Entrant,TournamentSystem.Entrant,TournamentSystem.Set.Game.GameStatus,System.Collections.Generic.Dictionary{System.String,System.String})
member.summary: Constructor for Game used when deserializing JSON when we already know the Winner and Status
member.remarks: Do not use unless you have a good reason to.

member.name: M:TournamentSystem.Set.Game.TryMovingToWaitingAsync
member.summary: Method to move from InProgress to Waiting - should only be used to roll-back misclicks. Returns true if succesful, otherwise false.
member.remarks: Locking handled in the method - no expectations on other locks
member.returns: Bool - true on success, false on failure

member.name: M:TournamentSystem.Set.Game.TryMovingToInProgressAsync
member.summary: Method to move from Waiting to InProgress.
member.remarks: Locking handled in the method - no expectations on other locks
member.returns: Bool - true if succesful, otherwise false.

member.name: M:TournamentSystem.Set.Game.SetWinnerAsync(TournamentSystem.Entrant)
member.summary: Method for setting the winner of the Game - contains checks to ensure the "Winner" is part of the Game.

member.name: M:TournamentSystem.Set.Game.SetStatus(TournamentSystem.Set.Game.GameStatus)
member.summary: Overrides the checks - DO NOT USE UNLESS YOU ARE LOADING A GAME FROM SOMEWHERE

member.name: T:TournamentSystem.Entrant
member.summary: Class that represents the idea of an entrant of the tournament
member.remarks: This class is meant to be immutable - once an entrant is created, to edit it we have to create a new one that copies from the old one.

member.name: F:TournamentSystem.Entrant._entrantData
member.remarks: This is a dictionary, as we don't have a set promise from the JSON as to what information can or can't be included, instead we just store directly from the JSON and any parsing is done when required

member.name: T:TournamentSystem.IndividualEntrant
member.summary: Represents an individual person entering the tournament

member.name: P:TournamentSystem.IndividualEntrant.EntrantName
member.remarks: This is kept as an EntrantName type - this is because I allow the JSON to specify the info firstName, lastName if you want to store them seperately, or just tag for a single string.

member.name: T:TournamentSystem.IndividualEntrant.Name
member.summary: Class representing a Name - either can be a normal 'person's' name (first name, last name) or a tag (i.e. pseudonyms - common in esports)

member.name: M:TournamentSystem.IndividualEntrant.Name.GetCondensedName
member.remarks: For now, we do hard-coded condensed versions, see relevant method, but this can be expanded to allow custom definitions of 'condensed' form in the JSON itself

member.name: M:TournamentSystem.IndividualEntrant.#ctor(System.Int32,System.String,System.Collections.Generic.Dictionary{System.String,System.String})
member.summary: Constructor for IndividualEntrant if we want them to have a Tag for a name.

member.name: M:TournamentSystem.IndividualEntrant.#ctor(System.Int32,System.String,System.String,System.Collections.Generic.Dictionary{System.String,System.String})
member.summary: Constructor for IndividualEntrant if we want them to have a FullName for a name.

member.name: T:TournamentSystem.TeamEntrant
member.summary: Class representing teams of IndividualEntrants
member.remarks: Allows storing data only to relevant to a group of entrants in one place, instead of duplicating it across all of them

member.name: M:TournamentSystem.TeamEntrant.#ctor(System.Int32,System.String,System.Collections.Generic.List{TournamentSystem.IndividualEntrant})
member.summary: Constructor for TeamEntrant where we specify the TeamName.

member.name: M:TournamentSystem.TeamEntrant.#ctor(System.Int32,System.Collections.Generic.List{TournamentSystem.IndividualEntrant})
member.summary: Constructor for TeamEntrant where we don't specify the TeamName.

member.name: M:TournamentServer.Main(System.String[])
member.summary: Allows passing of one command line argument - that being the path of the JSON of the tournament to load on startup.

member.name: T:TournamentServer.ServerHandler
member.summary: Class that handles processing requests and locking across class boundaries
member.remarks: This can almost surely be made in a more elegant way, but this works for now.

member.name: M:TournamentServer.ServerHandler.GetTournamentAsync
member.summary: Handles requests for the JSON of the whole tournament.

member.name: M:TournamentServer.ServerHandler.GetSetByIdAsync(System.Int32)
member.summary: Handles requests for a specific Set, searching sets by id. Returns a serialized JSON of just the set.

member.name: M:TournamentServer.ServerHandler.GetEntrantByIdAsync(System.Int32)
member.summary: Handles requests for a specific Entrant, searching entrants by id. Returns a serialized JSON of just the entrant.
member.remarks: TeamEntrants are serialized such that the contained IndividualEntrants are nested and also serialized.

member.name: M:TournamentServer.ServerHandler.GetAllDataAsync
member.summary: Handles requests for the entire Data dictionary. Returns serialized JSON.

member.name: M:TournamentServer.ServerHandler.GetDataByKeyAsync(System.String)
member.summary: Handles requests for a specific key-value pair in Data, searching by key. Returns serialized JSON.

member.name: M:TournamentServer.ServerHandler.GetStatusAsync
member.summary: Handles requests for the status of the tournament. Returns serialized JSON.

member.name: M:TournamentServer.ServerHandler.HandleTournamentPostAsync(Microsoft.AspNetCore.Http.HttpContext)
member.summary: Handles a full JSON of a tournament, that is to be parsed and used as the current tournament.

member.name: M:TournamentServer.ServerHandler.HandleTournamentStatusTransitionAsync(System.String)
member.summary: Handles requests for transitioning tournament betweens states.

member.name: M:TournamentServer.ServerHandler.HandleGamePostAsync(System.Int32,Microsoft.AspNetCore.Http.HttpContext)
member.summary: Handles requests that send a JSON serialized Game objecct and want it to be added to a given set (by id).
member.remarks: Handles locking across class boundaries.S

member.name: M:TournamentServer.ServerHandler.UpdateSetBasedOnGamesAsync(System.Int32)
member.summary: Handles requests that requests a set to be evaluated based on the state of its games (and find winner/loser).
member.remarks: Handles locking across class boundaries.

member.name: M:TournamentServer.ServerHandler.HandleSetStatusTransitionAsync(System.Int32,System.String)
member.summary: Handles requests to transition a Set (by id) between states.
member.remarks: Handles locking across class boundaries.

member.name: M:TournamentServer.ServerHandler.HandleSetMoveWinnersAndLoserAsync(System.Int32)
member.summary: Handles requests to move the winner and loser from a given set (by id) to the next set they play.
member.remarks: Handles locking across class boundaries.

member.name: M:TournamentServer.ServerHandler.HandleGameStatusTransitionAsync(System.Int32,System.Int32,System.String)
member.summary: Handles requests to transition a game (by number) of a set (by id) between states.
member.remarks: Handles locking across class boundaries.

member.name: M:TournamentServer.ServerHandler.HandleGameUpdateWinnerAsync(System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Handles requests to set the winner (passed as entrantId) of a game (by number) of a set (by id).
member.remarks: Handles locking across class boundaries.
